page.title: 10Farming_Sheep\Horticulture
page.content: There is only one sheep farm owned by Mr Peploe. He has no workers. He owns about 150 acres. He has 200 ewes and lambs and 4 rams. He sells his wool to Perce of Tame. His sheep are born in March and he keeps them about 4 months before they go to market. Mr Peploe has lived on the farm for 3 years. He came from Cumberland. He has 3 tractors and some machinery for cutting his crops. His sheep are grey faced ewes crossed with black faced ewes and border Leicesters. If a ewe has more than 2 lambs they swop all the sheep around. Rollright Heath Farm is family owned. They have 600 acres,mainly in cereals and horticulture. They grow crops like brussel sprouls,leeks,beans and onions which they take to the markets in London and Birmingham. They employ 17 men permanently and more seasonally.
